meanings.definition: A natural or inherent inclination or tendency towards a particular action or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her tendence towards kindness made her a beloved friend.
meanings.sent2: His tendence to procrastinate often caused him to miss deadlines.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's tendence to chew on shoes always keeps us on our toes.
meanings.sent4: The tendence of the river to meander through the valley is a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The tendence of the sun to set in a blaze of colors never fails to amaze me.

meanings.definition: The act of taking care of or looking after something.
meanings.sent1: Her tendence involved feeding the stray cats in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The tendence of the gardener towards the plants ensured a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent3: His tendence for organizing his desk bordered on obsession.
meanings.sent4: The tendence of the nurse to comfort patients was truly heartwarming.
meanings.sent5: The tendence of the teacher to guide her students was evident in their progress.

meanings.definition: The likelihood or probability of something happening.
meanings.sent1: There is a tendence for rain during the monsoon season.
meanings.sent2: The tendence of accidents increases during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: His tendence to win at board games always surprises his friends.
meanings.sent4: The tendence of the stock market to fluctuate keeps investors on their toes.
meanings.sent5: The tendence of flowers to bloom in spring fills the garden with color.
